intro: Larryleachia similis, commonly known as the coastal daisy, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and yellow, typically during the warmer months. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found growing along shorelines and dunes. It has a low-growing habit with narrow, grass-like leaves that help it withstand harsh coastal conditions. Larryleachia similis is an important component of coastal ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
